title: Apt Rust requirement raises questions
summary:
This LWN.net article discusses the controversy surrounding Debian's APT (Advanced Package Tool) potentially requiring Rust in May 2026. Julian Andres Klode, an APT maintainer, announced this plan, citing memory safety and improved unit testing as benefits for rewriting parts of APT (specifically .deb, .ar, .tar parsing and HTTP signature verification) in Rust.

This decision has sparked debate due to its impact on Debian ports that lack a Rust toolchain, potentially forcing them to either acquire one, sunset the port, or stick with older APT versions. While some developers welcome the move towards modern technologies like Rust, others criticize Klode's communication style and the lack of prior discussion.

Key concerns raised include: the burden on volunteer maintainers to support Rust, the impact on Debian's infrastructure due to the static linking nature of Rust packages leading to potential security support limitations, and the existing challenges Debian faces in managing Rust dependencies and tracking CVEs.

David Kalnischkies suggested removing the problematic code from APT altogether, as it's primarily used by Canonical's Launchpad software. Some fear this change goes against Debian's values of supporting diverse hardware and democratic governance, as it's a decision driven by a single developer without adequate community input.

Discussions also touched on potential solutions such as forking APT, creating a Rust-to-C converter, or contributing to existing Rust compilers. The debate also extended to the larger issue of static vs shared libraries, with some advocating for rebuilding packages with dependency updates, while others prefer shared libraries for easier maintenance.

title: FLUX.2: Frontier Visual Intelligence
summary:
FLUX.2, Black Forest Labs' latest visual intelligence model, is designed for real-world creative workflows, offering high-quality image generation with consistency across multiple references, structured prompt adherence, and advanced text handling. It edits images up to 4 megapixels while preserving detail.

Black Forest Labs emphasizes open innovation, combining open models like FLUX.1 (popular open image model) with professional-grade models like FLUX.1 Kontext. The open core approach aims to drive experimentation, scrutiny, and lower costs.

FLUX.2 offers significant improvements over FLUX.1, including multi-reference support (up to 10 images), improved image detail and photorealism, reliable text rendering, enhanced prompt following, improved world knowledge, and higher resolution output.

The FLUX.2 family includes FLUX.2 [pro] (state-of-the-art quality), FLUX.2 [flex] (full parameter control), FLUX.2 [dev] (32B open-weight model), and FLUX.2 [klein] (open-source model coming soon). A new variational autoencoder (VAE) underpins all FLUX.2 models, optimizing learnability, quality, and compression.

FLUX.2 utilizes a latent flow matching architecture, combining a vision-language model with a rectified flow transformer. This enables multi-reference support, higher resolution, better prompt adherence, and improved typography.

Black Forest Labs is committed to the responsible development of these models and seeks to build foundational infrastructure for visual intelligence, aiming for multimodal models unifying perception, generation, memory, and reasoning.

title: Human brains are preconfigured with instructions for understanding the world
summary:
UC Santa Cruz researchers have discovered that the human brain possesses preconfigured activity patterns even before sensory experiences occur, suggesting an inherent "operating system" guiding interaction with the world. They used brain organoids, 3D models of human brain tissue grown from stem cells, to study the earliest moments of electrical activity. The study, published in *Nature Neuroscience*, revealed that these early brain firings occur in structured patterns without external stimuli.

This research allows scientists to study human brain development ethically, which is normally protected inside the womb. By observing the organoids, the team found that the cells spontaneously emit electrical signals similar to the brain's "default mode," a basic underlying structure for firing neurons. These patterns, emerging in the first few months of development, have the potential to be refined for specific senses.

These findings have significant implications for understanding neurodevelopmental disorders and the impact of toxins on the developing brain. Identifying and studying these early patterns in organoids could pave the way for developing preclinical therapies, including drug therapies and gene editing tools, for brain disorders. The study highlights the potential of organoids to revolutionize our understanding of human brain development and its vulnerabilities.

chinese_summary:

这项研究使科学家们能够在伦理的框架下研究人脑发育，而这通常是在子宫内受到保护的。通过观察类器官，该团队发现细胞自发地发出类似于大脑“默认模式”的电信号，这是一种神经元放电的基本底层结构。这些模式出现在发育的最初几个月，有可能被优化用于特定的感觉。

这些发现对于理解神经发育障碍以及毒素对发育中的大脑的影响具有重大意义。识别和研究类器官中的这些早期模式可以为开发脑部疾病的临床前疗法铺平道路，包括药物疗法和基因编辑工具。这项研究突显了类器官在彻底改变我们对人脑发育及其脆弱性的理解方面的潜力。

title: Pebble Watch software is now open source
summary:
This article announces that Pebble watch software is now 100% open source, addressing concerns about the long-term sustainability of the platform. The author, who relaunched Pebble under Core Devices, highlights the importance of both hardware and software longevity.

On the hardware side, Core Devices is self-funded and aims to manufacture repairable watches, like the Pebble Time 2 with its replaceable battery and publicly available schematics for the Pebble 2 Duo.

The key development is the complete open-sourcing of Pebble software, including PebbleOS and the mobile companion app. This ensures the community can maintain and improve the software even if Core Devices ceases to exist. The article details how the new mobile app, built with Kotlin Multiplatform, is now open source.

The Pebble Appstore is also being decentralized. The mobile app will support multiple appstore "feeds," allowing anyone to create and host a Pebble app repository. Core Devices has launched its own feed, backing up apps to Archive.org. Developers can still monetize their apps.

Finally, the article provides an update on the Pebble Time 2, aiming to begin shipping in January with most arriving in March/April, acknowledging potential delays due to Chinese New Year. A video demo of pre-production PT2 watches is also available. Pre-order customers will soon be able to select their preferred color.

title: Trillions Spent and Big Software Projects Are Still Failing
summary:
This article, "Trillions Spent and Big Software Projects Are Still Failing," highlights the persistent issue of software project failures despite massive global IT spending. The author argues that failures are widespread across various sectors and countries, and the situation hasn't improved significantly over the past two decades. The promise of AI solving these issues is dismissed, citing the complexities of managing large-scale projects and the human element involved.

The article attributes failures to recurring issues like failures of imagination, unrealistic goals, inability to handle complexity, and unmanaged risks. It presents case studies like the Canadian government's Phoenix payroll system, the U.K. Post Office's Horizon system, and the Minnesota Licensing and Registration System (MNLARS) as prime examples of costly and damaging failures. These cases illustrate a pattern of technical, managerial, organizational, legal, and ethical shortcomings.

The rising cost of software failures is emphasized, with US operational software failures alone estimated at $1.81 trillion in 2022. Despite attempts to improve processes through Agile and DevOps, the article suggests that the lack of organizational discipline and commitment to proven practices hinders success. The author concludes by questioning why basic IT project management mistakes continue to occur, given the extensive history of failures and the increasing reliance on reliable software. The article argues that the IT community often fails to learn from past mistakes, leading to repeated and expensive failures, making it an existential threat to modern society.

title: Ozempic does not slow Alzheimer's, study finds
summary:
A two-year study by Novo Nordisk has revealed that Ozempic, a popular weight-loss drug, does not slow the progression of Alzheimer's disease. While early data suggested potential benefits for brain conditions, along with other ailments like cancer and heart disease, this new study contradicts those initial hopes.

The article highlights that researchers had questioned whether any observed positive effects were directly attributable to the drug or simply a consequence of weight loss and increased health consciousness in Ozempic users.

This latest finding is part of a trend of tempering earlier, more enthusiastic claims about Ozempic's broader benefits, as it also failed to demonstrate a slowing of neurodegeneration in Parkinson's patients. However, the drug's positive impact on cardiovascular and kidney problems appears to be more consistent and reliable.

Following the announcement of the Alzheimer's study results, Novo Nordisk's shares experienced a 6% decline.

title: Most Stable Raspberry Pi? Better NTP with Thermal Management
summary:
This article details how to improve the stability of a Raspberry Pi-based NTP server for precise timekeeping by addressing thermal-induced timing jitter. The author noticed frequency drift in the NTP server correlated with CPU temperature changes, despite a stable GPS PPS reference. The core issue: CPU frequency scaling and temperature-dependent crystal oscillator frequency.

The solution involves two main components: CPU core pinning and thermal stabilization. CPU core pinning dedicates CPU 0 to timing-critical tasks (chronyd and PPS interrupts) using a boot optimization script that sets the CPU governor to "performance," pins the PPS interrupt and chronyd to CPU 0, sets chronyd to real-time priority, and boosts the priority of the kernel softirq handler.

Thermal stabilization maintains a constant CPU temperature using a PID-controlled "time burner." This Python script reads the CPU temperature, calculates the necessary CPU load to maintain a target temperature (54°C), and distributes the load across CPUs 1-3 using worker processes that alternate between busy-loop hashing and sleeping. By maintaining a stable CPU temperature, the thermal environment of the physically close crystal oscillator is stabilized, leading to consistent clock frequency and improved timekeeping.

The results showed a significant improvement in frequency stability, with a nearly 50% reduction in mean RMS offset and a 52.7% reduction in median RMS offset. The article provides detailed setup instructions for replicating the optimization, including scripts for boot optimization and thermal stabilization, as well as systemd service configurations. The author emphasizes that maintaining consistent silicon temperature is more important for frequency stability than ambient air temperature changes.
chinese_title: 最稳定的树莓派？更好的NTP与散热管理
chinese_summary:
本文详细介绍了如何通过解决热致时序抖动来提高基于树莓派的NTP服务器的稳定性，以实现精确计时。作者注意到，尽管有稳定的GPS PPS参考，NTP服务器中的频率漂移与CPU温度变化相关。核心问题：CPU频率调整和温度相关的晶体振荡器频率。

解决方案包括两个主要组成部分：CPU核心绑定和热稳定。CPU核心绑定将CPU 0专用于时间关键型任务（chronyd和PPS中断），通过启动优化脚本将CPU调控器设置为“性能”模式，将PPS中断和chronyd绑定到CPU 0，将chronyd设置为实时优先级，并提高内核softirq处理程序的优先级。

热稳定使用PID控制的“时间燃烧器”来维持恒定的CPU温度。这个Python脚本读取CPU温度，计算维持目标温度（54°C）所需的CPU负载，并使用worker进程将负载分配到CPU 1-3上，这些进程在忙循环哈希和睡眠之间交替。通过维持稳定的CPU温度，物理上接近的晶体振荡器的热环境得到稳定，从而实现一致的时钟频率并改善计时。

结果表明，频率稳定性得到了显著改善，平均RMS偏移降低了近50%，中位数RMS偏移降低了52.7%。本文提供了复制优化的详细设置说明，包括启动优化和热稳定的脚本，以及systemd服务配置。作者强调，对于频率稳定性而言，保持硅温度一致比环境空气温度变化更重要。

title: Orion 1.0 – Browse Beyond
summary:
Orion 1.0, a privacy-focused browser from Kagi, has officially launched for macOS, leaving its beta phase. It joins the iOS and iPadOS apps, expanding the "Kagiverse" alongside their Search, Assistant, Translate, and News products. Orion aims to provide an alternative to ad-funded browsers by prioritizing user privacy and control with zero telemetry.

Built on WebKit, the open-source engine behind Safari, Orion distinguishes itself from the Chromium monoculture. It emphasizes speed, achieved through a lean codebase and optimized performance, and built-in privacy protections like content blocking. While embracing the potential of AI, Orion avoids integrating insecure, always-on AI agents directly into the browser core, preferring a clear separation between the browser and external AI tools.

Unique features include Focus Mode, Link Preview, Mini Toolbar, Overflow Menu, Page Tweak, and Profiles as Apps.

Developed by a small team of six, Orion is free to use. Sustainability is achieved through user contributions via a Tip Jar, Supporter Subscriptions ($5/month or $50/year), and Lifetime Access ($150). Supporters unlock perks like Floating windows, Customization, and early access to new features.

Orion aims to be available across platforms, with versions for macOS, iOS/iPadOS, Linux (Alpha), and Windows (in development). The roadmap includes deeper customization, performance improvements, new Orion+ features, and tighter integrations with Kagi's AI tools.

title: Unpowered SSDs slowly lose data
summary:
This article addresses the issue of data loss in unpowered SSDs over extended periods, highlighting that SSDs aren't ideal for long-term cold storage. Unlike hard drives that magnetically store data, SSDs rely on electrical charges in NAND flash cells, which can dissipate over time, especially when unpowered.

The data retention period varies depending on the type of NAND flash used: QLC NAND can safely store data for about a year, TLC NAND for up to 3 years, and MLC/SLC NAND for 5-10 years. Since most consumer SSDs use TLC or QLC NAND, leaving them unpowered for over a year poses a risk of data corruption or loss. Factors like temperature and NAND flash quality can accelerate voltage loss.

However, the author emphasizes this is primarily a concern for enterprise, enthusiast, and solopreneur use cases involving archival storage. For typical PC usage, with SSDs powered on regularly, the risk is minimal. The article also mentions that SSDs have limited write cycles that eventually bring them to the end of their lifecycle.

The key takeaway is the importance of data backups. The 3-2-1 backup rule (3 copies of data on 2 different media, with 1 off-site) is recommended to safeguard against data loss from any type of storage failure, including SSDs losing data due to prolonged unpowered storage. While SSDs are suitable for primary storage, relying on them for unpowered long-term archival purposes without backup is risky.
chinese_title: 未供电的固态硬盘会缓慢丢失数据
chinese_summary:
本文探讨了断电状态下固态硬盘长期存储数据丢失的问题，强调固态硬盘并非长期冷存储的理想选择。与磁性存储数据的硬盘不同，固态硬盘依赖于NAND闪存单元中的电荷，这些电荷会随着时间推移而消散，尤其是在断电情况下。

数据保持期因使用的NAND闪存类型而异：QLC NAND可安全存储数据约一年，TLC NAND可存储长达三年，而MLC/SLC NAND可存储五年到十年。由于大多数消费级固态硬盘使用TLC或QLC NAND，因此断电一年以上可能会导致数据损坏或丢失。温度和NAND闪存质量等因素会加速电压损耗。

然而，作者强调，这主要针对涉及档案存储的企业、发烧友和个体经营者的用例。对于典型的PC使用，由于固态硬盘经常通电，因此风险很小。文章还提到，固态硬盘的写入周期有限，最终会使其达到生命周期终点。

关键要点是数据备份的重要性。建议采用3-2-1备份规则（3份数据保存在2种不同的介质上，其中1份异地备份）以防止因任何类型的存储故障（包括固态硬盘因长期断电存储而丢失数据）造成的数据丢失。虽然固态硬盘适用于主存储，但在没有备份的情况下，依赖它们进行断电长期存档是很危险的。

title: Brain has five 'eras' with adult mode not starting until early 30s
summary:
This study identifies five distinct "eras" in human brain development, marked by four key "turning points" at ages nine, 32, 66, and 83. Researchers analyzed brain scans from nearly 4,000 individuals, mapping neural connections and their evolution from infancy to old age.

The first era, from birth to age nine, is characterized by "network consolidation," where synapse connections are pruned, brain wiring efficiency decreases, and grey and white matter volume rapidly increases. Adolescence, the second era lasting until approximately age 32, witnesses continued white matter growth and increased efficiency in brain connections, linked to improved cognitive function.

The most significant shift occurs around age 32, initiating "adult mode," a phase of relative brain stability. Brain regions become more compartmentalized, aligning with observed plateaus in intelligence and personality. While life events like parenthood may contribute, the research didn't directly investigate this.

The final two turning points, at ages 66 and 83, mark the beginning of "early aging" and "late aging" phases, respectively. These eras are defined by decreased brain connectivity potentially related to aging and white matter degeneration. The findings offer insights into brain development vulnerabilities and potential risk factors for mental health disorders, particularly during adolescence.

最重要的转变发生在32岁左右，启动了“成人模式”，这是一个大脑相对稳定的阶段。大脑区域变得更加分隔，与观察到的智力和人格的平稳期相一致。虽然诸如为人父母等生活事件可能有所贡献，但该研究并未对此进行直接调查。

最后两个转折点，分别在66岁和83岁，标志着“早期衰老”和“晚期衰老”阶段的开始。这些阶段的特点是大脑连接性降低，这可能与衰老和白质退化有关。该研究结果为大脑发育的脆弱性以及精神健康障碍的潜在风险因素提供了见解，尤其是在青春期。

title: Nearby peer discovery without GPS using environmental fingerprints
summary:
This article introduces Shimmer, a system for discovering nearby peers without GPS by using environmental fingerprints. It leverages the idea that devices in the same area likely observe the same set of environmental signals (e.g., WiFi networks, Bluetooth beacons).

Shimmer works by creating cryptographic fingerprints of these environmental observations using MinHash and Locality-Sensitive Hashing (LSH). MinHash generates a compact signature for each device's observed environment, while LSH creates "collision buckets" where similar signatures are likely to hash to the same value (publicTags). Devices then encrypt their peer information using preImages as keys and announce them to a rendezvous server using the publicTags as indexes. Other peers observing a similar environment can generate matching publicTags, allowing them to discover and decrypt the peer information.

The author outlines potential use cases like location-based multiplayer gaming and conference networking. Shimmer offers features like Private Set Intersection (PSI) for precise similarity scores, support for multiple modalities of data (WiFi, Bluetooth, shared interests), epoch-based expiry of sketches, and various rendezvous options.

The article also discusses security considerations, including the potential for spoofing environmental observations and the risk of the rendezvous server learning about IP proximity. Potential mitigations are proposed, such as using Tor, Oblivious HTTP (OHTTP), or a DHT for rendezvous. The author emphasizes that the suitability of Shimmer depends on the specific threat model. He built Shimmer as an interesting problem and considers trade-offs like server proximity and Android location permission requirements.

title: Broccoli Man, Remastered
summary:
This article details the author's experience recreating Google's "Broccoli Man" video using AI tools. Fifteen years after the original, the author spent a Saturday using Veo 3.1 and Nano Banana to create a remastered 4-minute short film.

The process involved:
*   **Preproduction:** Script preparation using AI Studio to break down the original video into scenes and brainstorming prompts. Character "ingredients" (Broccoli Man and Red Panda) were converted to photorealistic versions and backgrounds removed using Magic Markup (Nano Banana).
*   **Production:** Video generation using Vertex AI Studio and Veo 3.1 with "Ingredients to Scene." The process was iterative, with the author generating multiple samples per scene and tweaking prompts. Character consistency was surprisingly good, and audio sync was often achievable. Challenges included the rigid 8-second clip duration, recreating static conversation scenes, camera control, and achieving desired character emotes.
*   **Postproduction:** Using CapCut for editing, including trimming scenes, interleaving takes, manipulating audio, and dialogue volume normalization. The author emphasizes the necessity of non-linear video editing for this type of project.

The author concludes by stating that the AI tools allowed them to create something they wouldn't have otherwise, despite limitations and quirks. They believe that intent matters, contrasting the potential for creative expression with the "slop-farm" content.

title: Claude Advanced Tool Use
summary:
This article introduces three new features designed to enhance the capabilities of AI agents using the Claude model, specifically focusing on tool use and integration.

**1. Tool Search Tool:** Addresses the issue of excessive token consumption by large tool libraries. Instead of loading all tool definitions upfront, the Tool Search Tool enables Claude to dynamically discover tools on-demand. This significantly reduces context consumption (up to 85% token reduction) and improves tool selection accuracy, especially in systems with numerous tools. Tools are marked with `defer_loading: true` to prevent initial loading and are discovered only when needed.

**2. Programmatic Tool Calling:** Solves problems related to context pollution from intermediate results and inference overhead. Claude can now orchestrate tools through code (Python), allowing for complex logic, data processing, and efficient control flow. Instead of individual API calls for each tool and returning results to Claude's context, Claude writes code that calls multiple tools, processes their outputs, and only returns the final, relevant information to its context. This reduces token consumption, latency, and improves accuracy. Tools are enabled for programmatic calling by adding `code_execution` and specifying `allowed_callers`.

**3. Tool Use Examples:** Not discussed in depth in this summary, but it is intended to add examples for how to properly use tools to give context to Claude. JSON schema cannot express usage patterns, this feature is designed to add the necessary context.

These features aim to make Claude more effective at working with extensive tool libraries and complex workflows, opening up possibilities for building more powerful and efficient AI agents.

title: Explaining, at some length, Techmeme's 20 years of consistency
summary:
In its 20th anniversary post, Techmeme reflects on its consistent role as a vital tech news aggregator. Despite profound changes in technology, the web, and news consumption, Techmeme has maintained its core function: ranking and organizing links from various sources, including news outlets, personal sites, and social media, to provide a shared context for tech industry leaders.

However, maintaining this consistency has become increasingly challenging. Crawling news sites is harder due to paywalls and bot-blocking, requiring constant negotiation with publishers. The fragmentation and increased restrictions on social networks have diminished the availability of usable news signals. Finally, advertising revenue is more reliant on direct relationships with senior-level decision makers.

Techmeme argues that the idea of a complete media overhaul, where traditional journalism is replaced by "citizen journalism" or founders going direct, is largely exaggerated. Reputable news outlets still play a crucial role in fact-based storytelling, and tech professionals depend on these sources for reliable information. Moreover, while platforms like X can offer quick news updates, they represent only a slice of the overall tech news landscape, with significant conversations happening on other networks like Bluesky and Threads.

Looking ahead, Techmeme acknowledges the uncertainty of the future but is focused on building upon its existing foundation, including new ways for newsmakers and comms professionals to explicitly tip links. The article emphasizes that while the media landscape constantly evolves, the core principles of news dissemination remain relevant, enabling Techmeme to maintain its consistent presence.

然而，保持这种一致性变得越来越具有挑战性。由于付费墙和机器人拦截，抓取新闻网站变得更加困难，需要不断与出版商进行谈判。社交网络的碎片化和限制增加降低了可用新闻信号的可用性。最后，广告收入更加依赖于与高级决策者的直接关系。

Techmeme认为，传统新闻业被“公民新闻”或创始人直接发布内容所取代的彻底媒体改革的想法在很大程度上被夸大了。信誉良好的新闻媒体仍然在基于事实的叙事中发挥着至关重要的作用，科技专业人士依赖这些来源获取可靠的信息。此外，虽然像X这样的平台可以提供快速的新闻更新，但它们只代表整个科技新闻领域的一小部分，重要的对话发生在其他网络，如Bluesky和Threads。

展望未来，Techmeme承认未来的不确定性，但专注于在其现有基础上进行建设，包括新闻制作者和公关专业人员明确提示链接的新方法。文章强调，虽然媒体格局不断发展，但新闻传播的核心原则仍然适用，这使Techmeme能够保持其始终如一的存在。

title: Three Years from GPT-3 to Gemini 3
summary:
Ethan Mollick's article, "Three Years from GPT-3 to Gemini 3," reflects on the rapid advancements in AI since the release of ChatGPT and explores the capabilities of Google's new Gemini 3 model. Rather than benchmark scores, Mollick demonstrates AI's progress by showcasing Gemini 3's ability to perform complex tasks and function as a digital coworker.

He highlights the shift from simple chatbot functionalities to agentic models capable of coding, designing interfaces, and even creating interactive games. With the launch of Antigravity, Gemini 3 can access a computer, write programs, and complete tasks based on natural language instructions, effectively functioning as a general-purpose tool. Mollick illustrates this by having Gemini 3 analyze his past writings, conduct web research, and create a website summarizing his AI predictions.

Furthermore, Mollick tested Gemini 3's "PhD-level intelligence" by tasking it with analyzing a complex dataset and writing an original research paper. The AI successfully generated hypotheses, performed statistical analysis, and produced a formatted document. While the paper had some flaws, similar to a grad student's work, it demonstrated AI's ability to handle nuanced tasks requiring judgment and creativity.

Mollick concludes that Gemini 3 is a significant step forward, representing a shift from the "human in the loop" correcting AI errors to a collaborative model where humans direct AI work. While not perfect, Gemini 3 signifies the evolution of AI from chatbots to intelligent digital coworkers, necessitating new approaches to managing and guiding these increasingly capable systems.

title: How the Atomic Tests Looked Like from Los Angeles
summary:
This article discusses the atmospheric atomic tests conducted at the Nevada Test Site between 1951 and 1992 and their visibility from Los Angeles, which is about 240 miles away. The author highlights the casual and almost celebratory way these events were documented and perceived at the time, contrasting it with a modern understanding of the potential dangers.

The article cites newspaper reports and photographs that show how the atomic blasts illuminated the night sky, even causing a "second dawn" in Los Angeles. These events were considered newsworthy and captivating, with local TV stations broadcasting them live.

The author juxtaposes this casual attitude with the risks of radiation exposure. While acknowledging a naive fascination with nuclear weapons during the mid-20th century, the article also implies a lack of awareness or concern for the potential health consequences.

The article concludes by referencing Las Vegas's enthusiastic embrace of the atomic tests, with casinos and hotels hosting "atomic cocktail" parties to view the explosions. The comments section of the article highlights concerns about lingering radiation and disputes about the cause of cancer, underscoring the complex and controversial legacy of these tests.

title: Windows GUI – Good, Bad and Pretty Ugly (2023)
summary:
This article humorously ranks the evolution of the Windows Graphical User Interface (GUI) from its inception in 1985 with Windows 1.0 to the current Windows 11 (2023). The author uses a "Clippy" scale (1-10) to rate each major version based on how they look *now*, not necessarily how innovative they were at the time.

The rankings are: Windows 11 (8), Windows 2000 (8), Windows 95/98/Vista/7 (7.5), Windows 10 (6.5), Windows 3.0/3.1/XP (6), Windows 8.1 (5.5), Windows 8 (5), Windows 2.0 (2.5), and Windows 1.0 (1).

The author praises Windows 3.0 for offering a coherent GUI and professional look. Windows 95 is lauded for its functional design and impact on Apple. Windows Vista is recognized for its grown-up, glossy aesthetic. Windows 11 is considered the most refined since 2000, despite some limitations.

Windows XP is criticized for its cartoony appearance, while Windows 8 is deemed a major step back due to its tablet-centric design and removal of the Start menu. The early versions (1.0 and 2.0) are acknowledged as being limited by the technology of their time. Windows 10 is seen as a patchwork effort to recover from the mistakes of Windows 8.

The author concludes by speculating on the potential design of Windows 12, anticipating possible continuity with Windows 11.

title: A million ways to die from a data race in Go
summary:
This article by Philippe Gaultier explores common data race pitfalls in Go and offers solutions. It emphasizes that despite Go's reputation for concurrency, data races are easily introduced, leading to unpredictable behavior.

The first pitfall discussed is **accidental capture of outer variables in closures**, where goroutines unintentionally modify shared variables, fixable by declaring local variables within the closure.

The article then addresses the concurrent use of `http.Client`. While documented as concurrency-safe, modifying its fields like `CheckRedirect` concurrently is a data race. The solution is to use separate `http.Client` instances for each goroutine.

The third problem is the **improper lifetime of a mutex**. The author describes a scenario where a global map is protected by mutexes created within each HTTP handler, resulting in multiple mutexes guarding the same data, rendering synchronization ineffective. The fix involves either making both the data and mutex global or deep cloning the data for each handler.

Finally, the article briefly mentions common data races involving standard library containers like maps and slices and the need for synchronization using mutexes or concurrency-safe data structures.

The author concludes by suggesting that a better mutex API, inspired by Rust's approach of wrapping data, could mitigate some of these issues, and laments the lack of a built-in deep clone function in Go. He highlights that data races in Go are not just about synchronization but also about object ownership and object lifetime.

title: Build a Compiler in Five Projects
summary:

The course provides a practical, project-based approach to building a compiler for a progressively complex language that culminates in a language supporting features like variables, arithmetic, booleans, branching, heap-allocated vectors, loops, and functions with closures.

The core of the course is a series of five projects: p1 (Racket warmup), p2 (straight-line arithmetic to x86-64), p3 (booleans/branching to x86-64), p4 (vectors/mutation/loops to x86-64), and p5 (functions/lambdas/closures to x86-64). Each project comes with comprehensive test suites. *   **Metaprogramming:** Highlights the importance of designing blueprints for the compiler, leading to optimized code generation at compile time and reduced runtime overhead.
*   **Ranges:** Introduces the power of ranges for data processing, allowing for declarative, pipeline-like descriptions that are type-safe and reusable.
*   **RAII:** Reinforces the importance of Resource Acquisition Is Initialization (RAII) for ensuring resource safety and deterministic control, linking object lifetime to system stability.
*   **Shifting Responsibility:** Emphasizes a shift in focus from runtime execution to compile-time design and optimization.
*   **Re-learning C++:** Urges developers to "go back to school" and re-learn C++ to effectively utilize new language features.

The author illustrates these points with examples of integrating C++ concepts and ranges with Delphi libraries like VCL and FMX. Ultimately, the article calls for a new generation of C++ libraries that embrace concepts, typelists, and compile-time mechanisms, urging both library and compiler vendors to fully unlock the potential of the modern language.

title: The history of Indian science fiction
summary:
This article, "The Secret History of Indian Science Fiction," by Gautam Bhatia, traces the origins and evolution of the genre in India. Bhatia argues that Rokeya Sakhawat Hossain's "Sultana's Dream" (1905) is a seminal work of Indian SF, employing techniques like defamiliarization and cognitive estrangement to critique patriarchal social relations and envision a techno-utopian society.

The article explores the development of speculative fiction in India through Urdu and Bengali works, including *Tilism-e-Hoshruba* and Jagdish Chandra Bose's *Niruddeshar Kahini*, with the term "kalpavigyan" emerging to describe Bengali SF. It also examines Rahul Sankrityayan's utopian novel *Baeesveen Sadi*, and compares it to Yevgeny Zamyatin's dystopian *We*, highlighting the global conversation around utopian ideals.

Bhatia emphasizes the uniqueness of "Sultana's Dream" as a feminist work written in English, contrasting it with the dominance of social realism in post-colonial Indian English-language novels. The article further discusses the evolution of English-language SF in the West, including pulp magazines, the "Golden Age," the counter-cultural movements of the 1960s, and the rise of cyberpunk. The article highlights how Indian SF, while thriving in non-English languages with authors like Satyajit Ray and Sujatha, remained largely isolated from international trends and often focused on "scientifiction," blending entertainment with education.

It signifies that attackers are actively targeting developers and their dependencies through supply chain attacks. This campaign underscores the critical need for developers to carefully vet their dependencies, implement strong account security measures (like MFA), and regularly audit their projects for suspicious code. The findings from HelixGuard's open-source research aim to raise awareness and provide developers with information needed to protect themselves and their projects from this ongoing threat. The article serves as a warning and call to action for improved NPM security practices.

title: Mind-reading devices can now predict preconscious thoughts
summary:
This article discusses the advancements in brain-computer interfaces (BCIs) and their potential to decode preconscious thoughts and intentions. It highlights the case of Nancy Smith, who used a BCI implanted in her posterior parietal cortex to play music, with the device anticipating her actions before she consciously initiated them. This exemplifies the potential of "dual-implant" BCIs to improve prosthetic device performance by capturing intentions and pre-motor planning.

The article also explores the ethical concerns surrounding the increasing ability of these devices to access individuals' innermost thoughts, including preconscious ones. This raises questions about data privacy, potential manipulation, and the need for regulation, especially concerning consumer neurotech products that use EEG to monitor brain states. While clinical BCIs face medical regulations, consumer BCIs have limited oversight, potentially allowing companies to exploit neural data.

The article points out laws are being passed to protect neural data, but ethicists argue they need to address inferences companies can draw when combining neural information with other digital data. While implanted BCIs are not yet approved for general clinical use, companies like Synchron and Neuralink are making progress with clinical trials, focusing on restoring independence to individuals with paralysis.  Ultimately, BCI developers aim to go beyond the motor cortex to address psychiatric conditions by identifying and monitoring neural signatures and delivering tailored stimulation, which raises more ethical considerations.

title: Moving from OpenBSD to FreeBSD for firewalls
summary:
This is not an article about moving from OpenBSD to FreeBSD for firewalls. It's a message from Chris Siebenmann explaining why readers might be encountering an error message when accessing his blog, Wandering Thoughts, or his wiki, CSpace.

Siebenmann implemented anti-crawler measures to combat a surge in high-volume crawlers, particularly those using old Chrome browser user agents, a tactic prevalent among crawlers gathering data for LLM training. This system inadvertently blocks legitimate users with outdated browsers.

The message specifically addresses users of archive services like archive.today, archive.ph, and archive.is. These services are also inadvertently blocked because they crawl pages in a way indistinguishable from malicious actors, using old Chrome User-Agent values, distributed IP addresses, and sometimes falsified reverse DNS entries. title: AI has a deep understanding of how this code works
summary:
This GitHub issue details a pull request (PR) adding DWARF v5 debugging support to the OCaml native compiler for macOS and Linux (AMD64 and ARM64 architectures).  The goal is to enable source-level debugging in GDB and LLDB.

The PR implements core DWARF v5 support using inline strings to avoid linker issues, multi-compilation unit support with string table deduplication, and section-relative relocations.  It supports function/line-level debugging, parameter/local variable tracking, lexical blocks, and basic OCaml type information.  Platform support is comprehensive for Linux/ELF and macOS/Mach-O, explicitly disabling Windows.  A custom LLDB plug-in formats OCaml values, and a test suite validates functionality.

The implementation spans 37 commits, including DWARF primitive construction, line number program generation, code address tracking, and integration with the OCaml compilation pipeline. Key changes include upgrading from DWARF v4 to v5, utilizing `DW_FORM_string` to avoid macOS linker issues, and comprehensive validation tests for function/line breakpoints, type information, and multi-object linking.

The PR preserves source-level parameter names and local variables in DWARF debug info using a new `Variable_info` module. Lexical block support is added for nested scope tracking. Code was added to handle architecture-specific register number mappings and ensure DWARF sections are preserved during linking by passing the `-g` flag to the linker.

A reviewer identified unused functions, which were subsequently removed. A comment raises concerns about code attribution, questioning if the work heavily derives from another author.
chinese_title: AI 对这段代码的工作原理有深刻的理解。

此 GitHub issue 详细介绍了一个 pull request (PR)，该 PR 为 macOS 和 Linux（AMD64 和 ARM64 架构）的 OCaml 本机编译器添加了 DWARF v5 调试支持。目标是在 GDB 和 LLDB 中启用源代码级调试。

该 PR 实现了核心 DWARF v5 支持，使用内联字符串以避免链接器问题、使用字符串表去重的多编译单元支持以及节相对重定位。 它支持函数/行级调试、参数/局部变量跟踪、词法块和基本的 OCaml 类型信息。平台支持全面，覆盖 Linux/ELF 和 macOS/Mach-O，明确禁用了 Windows。 一个自定义的 LLDB 插件用于格式化 OCaml 值，一个测试套件用于验证功能。

该实现跨越 37 个提交，包括 DWARF 原始结构构建、行号程序生成、代码地址跟踪以及与 OCaml 编译管道的集成。 主要变更包括从 DWARF v4 升级到 v5、利用 `DW_FORM_string` 来避免 macOS 链接器问题，以及针对函数/行断点、类型信息和多对象链接的全面验证测试。

该 PR 使用一个新的 `Variable_info` 模块在 DWARF 调试信息中保留源代码级参数名称和局部变量。 添加了词法块支持以进行嵌套作用域跟踪。 添加了代码来处理特定于架构的寄存器编号映射，并通过将 `-g` 标志传递给链接器来确保在链接期间保留 DWARF 节。

title: The Bitter Lesson of LLM Extensions
summary:
This article, written in 2025, reflects on the evolution of extending Large Language Models (LLMs) over the past three years. It highlights the shift from simple text-based interactions to complex agent-based systems capable of interacting with codebases, browsers, and other tools.

The author traces the development through key milestones: ChatGPT Plugins (ambitious but premature due to model limitations), Custom Instructions (a simple but effective solution for repetitive context), Custom GPTs (a curated app approach), and ChatGPT Memory (automatic personalization). A significant advancement was Cursor's introduction of `.cursorrules` files, enabling context setting within code repositories.

The article then discusses the Model Context Protocol (MCP), a heavyweight client-server solution for tool integration and resource provision, deemed potentially overkill. Claude Code, an agent incorporating various extension mechanisms like CLAUDE.md, MCP, and slash commands, is presented as a comprehensive but developer-focused approach.

The turning point is the introduction of Agent Skills in Claude Code, a lighter-weight, markdown-based system reminiscent of ChatGPT Plugins but now viable due to improved model capabilities. Agent Skills allow models to utilize generic tools and instructions to accomplish tasks, marking a return to natural language extensibility.

The author concludes that the future of LLM extensions lies in equipping models with general-purpose tools and trusting them to leverage those tools effectively, essentially strapping a computer to an LLM. The author predicts a move away from complex protocols like MCP toward more accessible, natural language-based extensions. He envisions future applications seamlessly integrating LLMs with computational power, abstracting the underlying complexity from the end-user.
chinese_title: LLM扩展的惨痛教训
chinese_summary:
本文写于2025年，回顾了过去三年扩展大型语言模型(LLM)的演变。文章重点介绍了从简单的基于文本的交互到能够与代码库、浏览器和其他工具交互的复杂基于代理的系统的转变。

作者追溯了这一发展过程中的关键里程碑：ChatGPT插件（雄心勃勃但由于模型限制而过早）、自定义指令（一种简单但有效的重复上下文解决方案）、自定义GPT（一种精选的应用程序方法）和ChatGPT记忆（自动个性化）。一项重大进展是Cursor引入了`.cursorrules`文件，实现了在代码仓库中设置上下文。

文章随后讨论了模型上下文协议(MCP)，这是一种用于工具集成和资源配置的重量级客户端-服务器解决方案，被认为可能过于复杂。Claude Code是一种集成了各种扩展机制（如CLAUDE.md、MCP和斜杠命令）的代理，被呈现为一种全面但以开发者为中心的方法。

转折点是Claude Code中引入的代理技能，这是一种更轻量级的、基于Markdown的系统，让人联想到ChatGPT插件，但由于模型能力的提高，现在是可行的。代理技能允许模型利用通用工具和指令来完成任务，标志着回归到自然语言可扩展性。

作者总结道，LLM扩展的未来在于为模型配备通用工具，并相信它们能够有效地利用这些工具，本质上是将一台计算机绑在LLM上。作者预测，未来将从复杂的协议（如MCP）转向更易于访问的、基于自然语言的扩展。他设想未来的应用程序将无缝地将LLM与计算能力集成在一起，从而将底层复杂性从最终用户那里抽象出来。

title: Building the largest known Kubernetes cluster
summary:
In November 2025, Google Cloud announced it successfully ran a 130,000-node Kubernetes cluster in experimental mode, doubling the officially supported limit of GKE. This achievement addresses the increasing demand for large clusters driven by AI workloads, transitioning from chip constraints to power limitations. The article highlights the need for robust multi-cluster solutions like MultiKueue for distributed training across data centers.

Key architectural innovations enabling this scale include optimized read scalability using features like Consistent Reads from Cache and Snapshottable API Server Cache, reducing load on the central object datastore. A proprietary key-value store based on Google's Spanner distributed database was crucial, handling 13,000 QPS for lease object updates. Kueue, a job queueing controller, managed complex AI/ML environments with fair-sharing policies and "all-or-nothing" scheduling. The future involves workload-aware scheduling, simplifying large-scale applications on GKE. GCS FUSE with zonal Anywhere Cache provided efficient data access, reducing latency for AI workloads.

To validate GKE's performance, a four-phase benchmark simulated a dynamic AI environment with mixed workloads (low, medium, high priority) managed by Kueue and JobSet. The benchmark demonstrated GKE's ability to handle fluctuating demands, preempting lower-priority jobs, scaling to 130,000 pods in under 4 minutes, and sustaining a throughput of up to 1,000 Pods/second. Kueue dynamically allocated resources based on priority, showcasing GKE's elasticity and resource reallocation capabilities.

title: Fifty Shades of OOP
summary:
"Fifty Shades of OOP" is an article that avoids outright defending or attacking Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), instead aiming to provide a nuanced view by examining its core ideas individually. The author argues that the term "OOP" is used so broadly that productive conversations are difficult, and proposes treating it as a collection of interrelated concepts.

The article then surveys aspects of OOP, including:

*   **Classes:** Building on structs with methods, information hiding, and inheritance. Prototypes are presented as an alternative.
*   **Method Syntax:** A useful convention for operations on specific data, aiding IDE autocompletion and chaining. Downsides include limitations on definition outside of classes, implicit `this` pointers, and potential conflicts with free functions.
*   **Information Hiding:** Preventing invariant violation and separating stable interfaces. Drawbacks include potential boilerplate and abstraction inversion.
*   **Encapsulation:** Bundling data and functions. Alternatives like closures and module systems exist. Data-oriented design offers a coarser-grained alternative focusing on efficient data processing.
*   **Interfaces:** Promoting separation of interface and implementation, supporting polymorphism. Can have runtime costs, but not always.
*   **Late Binding:** Deferring method/member lookup to runtime, enabling hot-reloading but impacting performance and introducing potential errors.
*   **Dynamic Dispatch:** Selecting polymorphic operations at runtime, often implemented with virtual function tables. Can cause performance issues due to inlining limitations and cache misses.
*   **Inheritance:** The most iconic OOP feature, enabling dynamic dispatch, subtyping, interface segregation, and code reuse. Criticized for being non-orthogonal, imposing performance costs, unsound subtyping implementation, and rigidity.
*   **Subtyping Polymorphism:** Defining "is a" relationships between types. Supported by OOP through inheritance, but also by other constructs.
chinese_title: 面向对象编程的五十道阴影
chinese_summary:
《面向对象编程的五十度灰》是一篇避免直接捍卫或攻击面向对象编程(OOP)的文章，而是旨在通过单独审视其核心思想来提供一个细致的视角。作者认为，“OOP”一词的使用过于宽泛，导致富有成效的对话变得困难，并建议将其视为一系列相互关联的概念的集合。

文章随后考察了OOP的各个方面，包括：

*   **类：** 基于带有方法、信息隐藏和继承的结构体。原型被呈现为一种替代方案。
*   **方法语法：** 一种用于对特定数据进行操作的有用约定，有助于IDE自动完成和链式调用。缺点包括在类外部定义的限制、隐式的`this`指针以及与自由函数的潜在冲突。
*   **信息隐藏：** 防止违反不变式并分离稳定的接口。缺点包括潜在的样板代码和抽象反转。
*   **封装：** 捆绑数据和函数。存在诸如闭包和模块系统之类的替代方案。面向数据的设计提供了一种更粗粒度的替代方案，专注于高效的数据处理。
*   **接口：** 促进接口和实现的分离，支持多态。可能会有运行时成本，但并非总是如此。
*   **延迟绑定：** 将方法/成员查找推迟到运行时，从而实现热重载，但会影响性能并引入潜在错误。
*   **动态分派：** 在运行时选择多态操作，通常使用虚函数表实现。由于内联限制和缓存未命中，可能导致性能问题。
*   **继承：** 最具标志性的OOP特性，支持动态分派、子类型化、接口隔离和代码重用。因其非正交性、强加的性能成本、不健全的子类型化实现以及刚性而受到批评。
*   **子类型多态：** 定义类型之间的“是”关系。通过继承受到OOP的支持，但也受到其他构造的支持。

title: How did the Win 95 user interface code get brought to the Windows NT code base?
summary:
The article explains how the Windows 95 user interface was integrated into the Windows NT 4.0 codebase, highlighting the challenges and strategies employed.

For window manager features, the Windows NT team reimplemented the Windows 95 code as a reference, leveraging the shared ancestry from Windows 3.1 while adapting to the already diverged codebases. This was a one-way port from Windows 95 to Windows NT.

For Explorer and other user-mode components, the Windows 95 code was taken "as-is" and then modified in-place to suit the Windows NT environment, specifically adapting to Unicode. This led to the creation of Unicode variants of interfaces, like IShellLinkA and IShellLinkW. This was a bidirectional process, with changes made by the Windows NT team being merged back into the Windows 95 codebase to avoid redundant fixes.

To ensure stability in the Windows 95 code, the Windows NT team used techniques like `#ifdef WINNT` directives, macros like `TCHAR`, and the `SIZEOF` macro. `SIZEOF` served as an indicator of whether a `sizeof` call had been reviewed for Windows NT compatibility, aiding in the identification of areas still requiring inspection.

The merging process was complex due to the limitations of Microsoft's internal source code system, SLM, which didn't support branching. This required manually merging changes between codebases. The Windows NT team, including Dave Plummer, even had custom "You have been visited" calling cards made.
chinese_title: Win 95的用户界面代码是如何引入到Windows NT代码库中的？
chinese_summary:

对于资源管理器和其他用户模式组件，Windows 95的代码被“原样”采用，然后在适当的位置进行修改，以适应Windows NT环境，特别是适应Unicode。 这导致了诸如IShellLinkA和IShellLinkW等接口的Unicode变体的创建。这是一个双向过程，Windows NT团队所做的更改会被合并回Windows 95代码库中，以避免冗余修复。

为了确保Windows 95代码的稳定性，Windows NT团队使用了诸如`#ifdef WINNT`指令、`TCHAR`等宏以及`SIZEOF`宏等技术。 `SIZEOF`用于指示是否已针对Windows NT兼容性审查了`sizeof`调用，从而有助于识别仍需要检查的区域。

由于微软内部源代码系统SLM不支持分支，合并过程非常复杂。 这需要手动合并代码库之间的更改。 Windows NT团队，包括Dave Plummer，甚至制作了定制的“你已被访问”名片。

title: Inside Rust's std and parking_lot mutexes – who wins?
summary:
This article dives deep into the implementations of `std::sync::Mutex` and `parking_lot::Mutex` in Rust to determine their performance characteristics and when to choose one over the other.

The author explains that `std::sync::Mutex` leverages platform-specific mutex implementations, often using futexes (fast userspace mutexes) where available. Futexes rely on atomic operations and kernel-managed wait queues for efficiency. A unique feature is poisoning, where the mutex becomes unusable if a thread panics while holding it, preventing data corruption.

`parking_lot::Mutex` takes a different approach, using a single algorithm across all platforms and managing its own wait queues in user space via a global hash table. This allows it to use a single byte for its mutex state, unlike `std`'s larger AtomicU32 (required by kernel alignment for futex queues). It implements eventual fairness to prevent thread starvation by using a timer that, every ~0.5ms, forces the lock to be handed off to the longest waiting thread.

Benchmark results show that `std` generally performs better under moderate contention with short critical sections due to its efficient kernel-managed queues. However, `parking_lot` provides more even work distribution. Under heavy contention with long hold times, `parking_lot` often surpasses `std` in throughput and latency.
chinese_title: Rust标准库和parking_lot互斥锁的内部机制——谁更胜一筹？
chinese_summary:
本文深入探讨Rust中`std::sync::Mutex`和`parking_lot::Mutex`的实现，以确定它们的性能特征以及何时选择其中一个。

作者解释说，`std::sync::Mutex`利用平台特定的互斥锁实现，通常在使用futexes（快速用户空间互斥锁）的地方。Futexes依赖于原子操作和内核管理的等待队列以提高效率。一个独特的特性是中毒，如果一个线程在持有互斥锁时发生panic，互斥锁将变得不可用，从而防止数据损坏。

`parking_lot::Mutex`采取了一种不同的方法，在所有平台上使用单一算法，并通过全局哈希表在用户空间中管理自己的等待队列。这使得它可以使用单个字节作为其互斥锁状态，不像`std`的更大的AtomicU32（内核对futex队列对齐所需）。它实现了最终公平性，通过使用一个定时器（每约0.5毫秒）强制将锁传递给等待时间最长的线程，以防止线程饥饿。

基准测试结果表明，由于其高效的内核管理队列，`std`在具有短临界区的中等争用下通常表现更好。然而，`parking_lot`提供了更均匀的工作分配。在具有长持有时间的大量争用下，`parking_lot`通常在吞吐量和延迟方面超越`std`。

title: Japan's gamble to turn island of Hokkaido into global chip hub

title: The Cloudflare outage might be a good thing
summary:
This article argues that the recent Cloudflare outage, while disruptive, serves as a crucial wake-up call about the increasing centralization and fragility of the internet. The outage, triggered by a mundane config file issue, exposed how reliant essential services have become on a single point of failure. The author highlights the irony that the internet, initially designed for decentralization and resilience, has evolved into a system heavily dependent on a few key providers like Cloudflare and AWS.

The author uses the anecdote of a friend unable to get air for their tires due to the outage to illustrate how deeply intertwined digital infrastructure is with everyday life. From banking and retail to government services and even filling up tires, our society is increasingly mediated through the internet, making it vulnerable to widespread disruptions when centralized services fail.

The article draws a parallel to the COVID-19 pandemic and its impact on global supply chains, arguing that the pursuit of lean and efficient systems led to vulnerabilities exposed during the crisis. Just as businesses learned to diversify and build slack into their supply chains, the author urges organizations and governments to create redundancies and offline alternatives for critical services.

The author concludes that outages like the Cloudflare one, while inconvenient, are valuable warnings. They highlight the dangers of relying on a small number of providers and encourage the development of more resilient, decentralized systems capable of withstanding future disruptions, including potential cyberattacks or failures within key infrastructure providers. The call to action is to embrace outages as learning opportunities and proactively build redundancy into our digital infrastructure.

文章将此事与COVID-19大流行及其对全球供应链的影响进行了比较，认为对精益高效系统的追求导致了危机期间暴露出来的漏洞。正如企业学会多元化并建立供应链缓冲一样，作者敦促组织和政府为关键服务创建冗余和离线替代方案。

作者总结说，像Cloudflare这样的中断虽然不便，但却是宝贵的警告。它们突显了依赖少数提供商的危险，并鼓励开发更具弹性、分散的系统，以便能够承受未来的中断，包括潜在的网络攻击或关键基础设施提供商内部的故障。行动呼吁是将中断视为学习机会，并主动在我们的数字基础设施中建立冗余。

title: Bytes before FLOPS: your algorithm is (mostly) fine, your data isn't
summary:
David Miličević's article "Bytes before FLOPS" emphasizes data-oriented optimization as the key to improving performance. He argues that focusing on efficient data handling often yields greater improvements than optimizing algorithms alone.

The article outlines a step-by-step approach:

1.  **Profile:** Identify bottlenecks through profiling, often revealing unexpected areas of concern.
2.  **Specialize the Algorithm:** Tailor algorithms to the specific data being processed, removing unnecessary generality for performance gains.
3.  **Make it Cache Friendly:** Optimize data access patterns for cache efficiency by accessing nearby or recently accessed data, reordering structure members and considering techniques like non-temporal writes. Type compression helps keep more data in cache.
4.  **Make it SIMD:** Vectorize the algorithm by processing data in parallel using SIMD instructions. Rearrange data into SoA or AoSoA structures.
5.  **Make it Parallel:** Parallelize independent data processing streams using tools like OpenMP or Rayon, while addressing false sharing with padding.

The article stresses the importance of understanding data flow, memory access, and cache behavior. It highlights that optimizing data layout and access patterns can lead to significant speedups, often exceeding the benefits of pure algorithmic optimization. It also briefly discusses the suitability of different programming languages for data-intensive tasks, favoring systems languages like C/C++/Rust for optimal control over data layout and memory management, whilst also offering resources and tools for performance analysis and data-oriented design.
chinese_title: 内存带宽瓶颈：你的算法问题不大，数据有问题
chinese_summary:
David Miličević的文章《Bytes before FLOPS》强调以数据为导向的优化是提高性能的关键。他认为，专注于高效的数据处理通常比仅仅优化算法能带来更大的改进。

文章概述了一个循序渐进的方法：

1.  **分析（Profile）：** 通过性能分析识别瓶颈，通常会揭示意想不到的问题区域。
2.  **算法特化（Specialize the Algorithm）：** 根据正在处理的特定数据定制算法，消除不必要的通用性以提高性能。
3.  **缓存友好化（Make it Cache Friendly）：** 通过访问附近或最近访问的数据来优化数据访问模式，从而提高缓存效率，包括重新排列结构成员并考虑非临时写入等技术。类型压缩有助于在缓存中保存更多数据。
4.  **SIMD化（Make it SIMD）：** 使用SIMD指令并行处理数据，实现算法的向量化。将数据重新排列成SoA或AoSoA结构。
5.  **并行化（Make it Parallel）：** 使用OpenMP或Rayon等工具并行处理独立的数据流，同时使用填充解决伪共享问题。

文章强调了理解数据流、内存访问和缓存行为的重要性。它强调优化数据布局和访问模式可以带来显著的加速，通常超过纯算法优化的好处。文章还简要讨论了不同编程语言对数据密集型任务的适用性，倾向于使用C/C++/Rust等系统语言来获得对数据布局和内存管理的最佳控制，同时也提供了性能分析和数据导向设计的资源和工具。

title: The only GM EV1 ever publicly sold
summary:
In October 2025, Brian Silvestro reported on the wild story behind VIN #4G5PX2250V0200212, the only GM EV1 ever publicly sold. This EV1, originally leased in 1997, was meant to be crushed like most others due to low demand and high costs. Jonathan Sawyer, the original lessee, explained that his lawsuit against GM may have saved it from the crusher.

The car ended up abandoned at Clark Atlanta University and was subsequently towed. In a surprising turn of events, the tow pound auctioned off the EV1, which was purchased by an anonymous EV enthusiast named Billy for over $118,000. Billy, who plans to open an electric car museum, is now undertaking a full restoration of the EV1.

The EV1 was a groundbreaking electric car in the 1990s, leased primarily in Southern states due to battery limitations. Despite its low horsepower, it featured innovations like regenerative braking and an aerodynamic design. GM recalled and crushed most EV1s, donating only a few to museums and universities. Billy's EV1 is a unique case, having survived a series of legal and logistical oddities.

The restoration process will be challenging due to missing parts, including the battery pack and a driveline control module. Billy is seeking assistance from the EV1 community and aims to have the car running by November 2026, the 30th anniversary of the EV1's initial drive.

EV1是20世纪90年代一款具有开创性的电动汽车，由于电池的限制，主要在南方各州租赁。尽管马力较低，但它具有再生制动和空气动力学设计等创新功能。通用汽车召回并压碎了大部分EV1，仅向博物馆和大学捐赠了少数。比利的EV1是一个独特的案例，在经历了一系列法律和后勤方面的怪事后幸存了下来。

由于缺少零件，包括电池组和传动系统控制模块，修复过程将充满挑战。比利正在寻求EV1社区的帮助，并计划在2026年11月，即EV1首次行驶30周年之际，让这辆车重新运行。

title: Eggroll: Novel general-purpose machine learning algorithm provides 100x speed
summary:
EGGROLL, or Evolution Guided General Optimization via Low-rank Learning, is a novel machine learning algorithm that achieves a hundredfold increase in training speed compared to naive evolution strategies (ES), making large-scale model training, including LLMs, more practical. It bridges the gap between inference and training by enabling efficient fine-tuning and training of new architectures from scratch.

EGGROLL uses a low-rank matrix perturbation technique to reduce computational and memory costs associated with traditional ES, enabling efficient scaling to large population sizes for models with billions of parameters. This technique reduces auxiliary storage and forward pass costs, leading to significant training throughput improvements, nearly matching the speed of pure batch inference.

The algorithm's effectiveness is demonstrated through several experiments: it performs comparably to ES in reinforcement learning settings, competes with GRPO in improving LLM reasoning, and enables stable pre-training of nonlinear recurrent language models operating purely on integer datatypes (dubbed "EGG"). The researchers showcase EGGROLL's capabilities by training an EGG model on the MiniPile dataset with impressive results, even when removing all activation functions. They also demonstrate its effectiveness in fine-tuning RWKV-7 language models for reasoning tasks, outperforming existing methods like GRPO.

The authors have released code, a research paper, and a single-file implementation of pure int8 language model training to encourage community contributions. They are actively working on scaling EGGROLL to larger population sizes and exploring its application to other language model architectures and neurosymbolic systems.

该算法的有效性通过几个实验得到证明：它在强化学习设置中与 ES 表现相当，在改进 LLM 推理方面与 GRPO 竞争，并且能够稳定地预训练纯粹基于整数数据类型运行的非线性循环语言模型（称为“EGG”）。研究人员通过在 MiniPile 数据集上训练一个 EGG 模型，取得了令人印象深刻的结果，即使移除所有激活函数也是如此，从而展示了 EGGROLL 的能力。他们还展示了它在微调 RWKV-7 语言模型以执行推理任务方面的有效性，优于 GRPO 等现有方法。

title: Show HN: We cut RAG latency ~2× by switching embedding model
summary:

This change resulted in a ~66% reduction in vector database storage, a 2-2.5x improvement in retrieval latency, and a 15-20% reduction in end-to-end voice latency.

The switch was motivated by the high storage and computational costs associated with high-dimensional embeddings in large-scale RAG systems. Voyage-3.5-lite, leveraging Matryoshka Representation Learning (MRL), maintains comparable or even better retrieval quality with significantly fewer dimensions, making it ideal for latency-sensitive applications.

The improved retrieval speed directly enhanced the user experience, particularly in voice interactions, by reducing the "robotic pause" between turns. The shift also translated into lower infrastructure costs, allowing MyClone to scale more efficiently and reinvest resources into richer features.

The article emphasizes that embedding choice is a crucial product decision, and models optimized for retrieval quality, flexible dimensions, and quantization, like Voyage-3.5-lite, will become increasingly important for latency-sensitive, knowledge-heavy applications. MyClone achieved better UX, lower costs, and future flexibility by strategically selecting an embedding model aligned with the specific needs of its RAG system.

title: I built a faster Notion in Rust
summary:
Imed built Outcrop, a faster Notion alternative in Rust, driven by frustration with existing knowledge base solutions. Inspired by Stripe's internal knowledge base success and recognizing the timing with Atlassian's sunsetting Data Center, Imed aimed for speed and simplicity.

Initially prototyping in Go, Imed encountered boilerplate code overload, leading to a switch to Rust. Rust's macro crates enabled a reduction in code, addressing challenges like real-time collaboration, search latency, and access control. A key innovation is a lightweight, in-memory Zanzibar-inspired authorization system persisted to Postgres, offering fast permission checks. The search engine leverages tantivy and incorporates language detection with whatlang, ensuring only accessible resources are considered.

Collaboration is handled via a custom port of prosemirror to Rust, improving document edit application speed. This enables efficient extraction of text, links, and mentions, paving the way for features like tab completion and structured suggestions powered by language models. Solid.js is integrated with prosemirror for the editor's UI.

Imed envisions Outcrop beyond just prose, encompassing diagrams, plots, and spreadsheets, with a focus on structured workflows and integrations with task management tools. The product is slated for launch within six months, priced around $10 per seat, with sponsorship options available.

title: TSMC Arizona outage saw fab halt, Apple wafers scrapped
summary:
In late September 2025, a power outage at a Linde industrial gas facility, a key vendor for TSMC, caused a halt in production at TSMC's Fab 21 in Arizona. This outage forced the company to scrap thousands of wafers in production for major clients like Apple, Nvidia, and AMD. While TSMC typically handles its own gas supply in Taiwan, it outsourced this function in Arizona.

The incident impacted TSMC's profitability in the third quarter, contributing to a significant drop in net income, although the company cited overall ramp-up costs for overseas fabs as a factor. While TSMC declined to comment directly on the outage, they acknowledged the influence of multiple factors on profit.

The financial impact on TSMC is expected to be partially covered by insurance, and the effect on clients is considered negligible due to the relatively small capacity of Fab 21 and the prior production of many products in Taiwan. TSMC is addressing the issue with Linde and emphasizing the need for operational improvements at overseas facilities.

This incident highlights the challenges Taiwanese manufacturers face when relying on non-Taiwanese firms at overseas facilities and underscores the importance of reliable supply chains. This isn't the first vendor issue that has caused shutdowns, with contaminations and a computer virus causing production delays in the past.

title: Slicing Is All You Need: Towards a Universal One-Sided Distributed MatMul
summary:
This paper, titled "Slicing Is All You Need: Towards A Universal One-Sided Algorithm for Distributed Matrix Multiplication," presents a novel approach to distributed matrix multiplication that aims to overcome the limitations of existing algorithms. The authors, Benjamin Brock and Renato Golin, propose a universal one-sided algorithm capable of supporting any combination of partitioning schemes and replication factors.

The core idea revolves around using "slicing" (index arithmetic) to determine the overlapping tiles that need to be multiplied together. This generates a list of local matrix multiplies which can then be executed directly or optimized through an intermediate representation (IR) to maximize overlap. The algorithm is implemented using a high-level C++-based PGAS programming framework, facilitating direct GPU-to-GPU communication using intra-node interconnects.

The key advantage of this algorithm is its universality, eliminating the need for multiple algorithm implementations for different partitioning strategies and avoiding costly data redistribution. The authors demonstrate the algorithm's performance across a wide range of partitioning and replication factors, showing that it is competitive with PyTorch DTensor, a highly optimized distributed tensor library used in AI models. The paper argues that this slicing-based approach provides a flexible and efficient solution for distributed matrix multiplication, suitable for various scientific, data analytics, and AI workloads.

title: Voyager 1 approaches one light day from Earth
summary:
In November 2026, Voyager 1 will achieve a significant milestone: becoming the first spacecraft to be one light day away from Earth, meaning it will take 24 hours for a radio signal to reach it. Launched in 1977, Voyager 1 has journeyed far beyond the solar system after its initial flybys of Jupiter and Saturn. Currently, at approximately 15.7 billion miles from Earth, a one-way message takes roughly 23 hours and 32 minutes to reach the probe.

The article emphasizes the increasing communication delays inherent in deep space travel, contrasting the near-instantaneous communication we experience on Earth with the delays encountered with the Apollo Moon missions (2.6 seconds) and missions to Mars (up to four minutes). These delays necessitate a high degree of autonomy for robotic spacecraft.

Although Voyager 1 is nearing the end of its operational lifespan due to its nuclear power source dwindling, it continues to function. Despite the challenges of communicating across such vast distances, NASA's Deep Space Network maintains contact with both Voyager 1 and its sister craft, Voyager 2 (currently at 19.5 light hours). The impending one light day milestone for Voyager 1 will require NASA engineers to exercise patience as commands will take two full days to be acknowledged by the distant probe.

title: How sea turtles learn locations using Earth’s magnetic field: research
summary:
Researchers at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill have made significant progress in understanding how sea turtles learn and use the Earth's magnetic field to navigate. The research, published in *Current Biology*, demonstrates that sea turtles learn the magnetic signatures of important locations during their juvenile years. This is crucial for their ability to return to specific nesting beaches as adults, sometimes after migrating thousands of miles.

The study involved exposing juvenile sea turtles to different magnetic fields in a controlled environment and observing their swimming behavior. The researchers found that the turtles did not simply react instinctively to specific magnetic fields, but rather learned to associate certain magnetic signatures with desirable locations. This learning process likely occurs early in their lives as they explore coastal habitats.

Key findings include:

*   Sea turtles learn the magnetic signatures of specific locations, rather than simply responding instinctively to them.
*   This learning likely occurs during their juvenile "lost years" phase in coastal habitats.
*   This learned association between magnetic signatures and locations is vital for their ability to navigate back to nesting beaches.

This research provides valuable insights into the complex navigation abilities of sea turtles and highlights the importance of coastal habitats for their development. Understanding this learning mechanism is crucial for developing effective conservation strategies, particularly in the face of changing magnetic fields and habitat degradation.
chinese_title: 海龟如何利用地球磁场学习定位：研究
chinese_summary:
北卡罗来纳大学教堂山分校的研究人员在了解海龟如何学习和利用地球磁场进行导航方面取得了重大进展。这项发表在《当代生物学》上的研究表明，幼年海龟会学习重要位置的磁场特征。这对于它们成年后返回特定筑巢海滩的能力至关重要，有时需要迁徙数千英里。

该研究包括在受控环境中将幼年海龟暴露于不同的磁场，并观察它们的游泳行为。研究人员发现，海龟并非仅仅本能地对特定磁场做出反应，而是学会将某些磁场特征与理想的位置联系起来。这种学习过程很可能发生在它们生命早期，当它们探索沿海栖息地时。

主要发现包括：

*   海龟学习特定位置的磁场特征，而不是仅仅本能地对它们做出反应。

title: You can see a working Quantum Computer in IBM's London office
summary:
In a surprising display of futuristic technology, IBM has installed a working Quantum Computer, the IBM Quantum System One, at its London office in Waterloo. Launched in 2019, this circuit-based quantum computer leverages the principles of quantum physics, allowing it to perform calculations exponentially faster than classical computers by using quantum bits that can be both One and Zero simultaneously.

While unlikely to become a household item, quantum computers hold the potential to replace traditional supercomputers in handling complex calculations. The challenge lies in their construction, requiring extremely low temperatures to maintain the delicate quantum state. This necessitates a steampunk-esque cooling system.

The computer, currently in use by companies, is visible to the public through the office window on York Road, near Waterloo Station. While access to the interior is restricted, observers can witness the future of supercomputing from the outside. The visually striking display was created in partnership with London-based Map Project Office and Universal Design Studio, alongside Milanese manufacturer Goppion, known for high-end museum showcases. The article highlights the accessibility of this cutting-edge technology, allowing the public to glimpse the power and potential of quantum computing firsthand.

虽然不太可能成为家用物品，但量子计算机有潜力取代传统超级计算机来处理复杂计算。 挑战在于它们的构建，需要极低的温度来维持脆弱的量子态。 这就需要一个蒸汽朋克式的冷却系统。

title: $2B Counter-Strike 2 crash exposes a legal black hole
summary:
João Marinotti's article dissects the $2 billion crash in the Counter-Strike 2 digital marketplace, triggered by Valve's unilateral rule change regarding "trade up contracts." This change flooded the market with rare items, drastically reducing the value of existing skins. Marinotti argues this incident highlights a legal blind spot: digital economies are primarily governed by private terms-of-service agreements, lacking the robust regulatory oversight of traditional financial markets.

The core issue is that players don't legally own their "skins"; they only license them. This distinction, affirmed by U.S. courts, means Valve can alter the terms of the license without violating property rights, leaving players with no legal recourse for their financial losses. Existing consumer protection laws are insufficient, as they focus on transparency about licensing, not protecting the speculative value of digital items.

Marinotti further argues that the Counter-Strike 2 economy exhibits characteristics of a financial market, yet it avoids regulation. He applies the Howey test for securities, suggesting that skins could potentially qualify due to the investment of money, common enterprise, expectation of profit, and reliance on Valve's managerial efforts. However, the consumptive intent of skins, the lack of in-platform cash conversion, and Valve's licensing scheme currently circumvent securities regulation. The author concludes that as digital economies expand, society needs to consider integrating them into stronger legal frameworks to protect investors and consumers.
chinese_title: 20亿美元反恐精英2崩溃事件暴露了法律漏洞
chinese_summary:
João Marinotti的文章剖析了因Valve单方面修改“交易升级合同”规则而引发的《反恐精英2》数字市场20亿美元的崩盘。这一变动导致稀有物品涌入市场，大幅降低了现有皮肤的价值。Marinotti认为，该事件突显了一个法律盲点：数字经济主要受私人服务条款协议管辖，缺乏传统金融市场那样健全的监管。

核心问题是玩家在法律上并不拥有他们的“皮肤”，而只是对其进行许可。美国法院已经确认了这一区别，这意味着Valve可以在不侵犯财产权的情况下更改许可条款，使玩家对其经济损失无从追索。现有的消费者保护法不足以解决问题，因为它们侧重于许可的透明度，而不是保护数字物品的投机价值。

Marinotti进一步指出，《反恐精英2》的经济表现出金融市场的特征，但却规避了监管。他应用了豪威测试来判断证券，认为皮肤有可能符合证券的定义，因为涉及资金投入、共同企业、盈利预期以及对Valve管理努力的依赖。然而，皮肤的消费意图、缺乏平台内的现金转换以及Valve的许可计划目前规避了证券监管。作者总结道，随着数字经济的扩张，社会需要考虑将它们纳入更强大的法律框架，以保护投资者和消费者。

title: A fast EDN (Extensible Data Notation) reader written in C11 with SIMD boost
summary:
This document is about `EDN.C`, a fast, zero-copy EDN (Extensible Data Notation) reader library written in C11 with SIMD acceleration (NEON, SSE4.2, SIMD128). EDN is described as a "JSON with superpowers," offering more expressive types (keywords, symbols, sets) and extensibility through tagged literals.

The library boasts features like: high performance with SIMD, WebAssembly support, minimal allocations (zero-copy), a simple API, memory safety via an arena allocator, zero dependencies (pure C11), comprehensive testing, UTF-8 native support, and optional support for tagged literals, map namespace syntax, extended character literals, metadata, text blocks, ratio numbers, extended integer formats, and underscores in numeric literals.

The document provides instructions for installation (Unix/macOS/Linux, Windows) and integration into projects, including linking the static library or including source files directly. A quick start example demonstrates basic usage, including parsing an EDN string, accessing map entries, and freeing memory. It details how whitespace and control characters are handled.

The API reference section covers core functions like `edn_read()` (reading EDN from a string), `edn_free()` (freeing memory), and `edn_type()` (getting the type of an EDN value). It also describes functions for accessing specific data types such as strings, booleans, integers, big integers, floats, big decimals, and (optionally) ratio numbers.

chinese_summary:

该库具有以下特性：SIMD带来的高性能、WebAssembly支持、最小分配（零拷贝）、简单的API、通过arena分配器实现的内存安全、零依赖（纯C11）、全面的测试、UTF-8原生支持，以及对标记文字、映射命名空间语法、扩展字符文字、元数据、文本块、比例数、扩展整数格式和数字文字中的下划线等的可选支持。

本文档提供了安装（Unix/macOS/Linux、Windows）和集成到项目中的说明，包括链接静态库或直接包含源文件。一个快速入门示例演示了基本用法，包括解析EDN字符串、访问映射条目和释放内存。它详细说明了如何处理空格和控制字符。

API参考部分涵盖了核心函数，例如 `edn_read()`（从字符串读取EDN）、`edn_free()`（释放内存）和 `edn_type()`（获取EDN值的类型）。它还描述了用于访问特定数据类型的函数，例如字符串、布尔值、整数、大整数、浮点数、大十进制数和（可选）比例数。

title: Fran Sans – font inspired by San Francisco light rail displays
summary:
Emily Sneddon's article details the creation of "Fran Sans," a display font inspired by the LCD destination displays found on San Francisco's Muni Breda light rail vehicles. She was drawn to the displays' mechanical yet personal feel, characterized by geometric modules creating imperfect letterforms with a unique charm.

Sneddon visited the SFMTA's Electronics Shop, where technician Armando Lumbad explained how the signs work and revealed they were designed by Trans-Lite, Inc. in 1999. She connected with Gary Wallberg, the engineer behind the signs, who confirmed they were designed for sufficiency, with characters created only as needed. This inspired Sneddon to create Fran Sans, capturing the essence of this utilitarian typography.

With encouragement from Dave Foster, Sneddon developed the font in Glyphs, using modules to build uppercase letters, numerals, and punctuation. She acknowledges that some glyphs remain unsolved and lowercase is a future consideration. Fran Sans comes in three styles: Solid, Tile, and Panel, inspired by Bell Shakespeare's adaptable typeface.

Sneddon also credits the Letterform Archive for inspiring her modular approach, highlighting Joan Trochut's Tipo Veloz and Zuzana Licko's Lo-Res.

With the Breda vehicles being replaced and their displays phased out, Sneddon hopes Fran Sans will preserve a distinctive part of San Francisco's character and inspire appreciation for imperfections. She also thanks numerous individuals who assisted her in the creation of Fran Sans, including the SFMTA employees, the designers from Trans-Lite, and her design peers. The article concludes with a poem from Maddy Carrucan.
chinese_title: Fran Sans – 灵感源自旧金山轻轨显示的字体
chinese_summary:
艾米丽·斯内登的文章详细介绍了“Fran Sans”字体的创作，这是一款受旧金山Muni Breda轻轨车辆上的LCD目的地显示器启发的展示字体。她被这些显示器的机械感与个性化感觉所吸引，其特点是由几何模块构成的不完美的字母，具有独特的魅力。

斯内登参观了SFMTA的电子商店，技术员Armando Lumbad解释了这些标志的工作原理，并透露它们是由Trans-Lite, Inc.于1999年设计的。她联系了负责这些标志的工程师Gary Wallberg，他确认这些标志的设计是为了满足需求，字符仅在需要时才创建。这激发了斯内登创作Fran Sans的灵感，捕捉了这种实用主义排版的精髓。

在Dave Foster的鼓励下，斯内登在Glyphs中开发了这款字体，使用模块构建大写字母、数字和标点符号。她承认有些字形仍然未解决，小写字母是未来需要考虑的问题。Fran Sans有三种样式：Solid、Tile和Panel，灵感来自Bell Shakespeare的可适应字体。

斯内登还感谢Letterform Archive启发了她的模块化方法，并特别提到了Joan Trochut的Tipo Veloz和Zuzana Licko的Lo-Res。

随着Breda车辆的更换及其显示器的逐步淘汰，斯内登希望Fran Sans能够保留旧金山独特的一部分特征，并激发人们对不完美的欣赏。她还感谢许多在Fran Sans创作过程中帮助过她的人，包括SFMTA员工、Trans-Lite的设计师以及她的设计同行。文章最后附有Maddy Carrucan的一首诗。

title: GrapheneOS migrates server infrastructure from France
summary:
GrapheneOS, a privacy-focused operating system, is moving its server infrastructure out of France, citing safety concerns for open-source privacy projects. The project is relocating its website, Mastodon, Discourse, and Matrix servers to Toronto and Germany, specifically to Netcup. This decision was prompted by the French government's support of the EU Chat Control proposal and negative press coverage from Le Parisien, which GrapheneOS believes conflates their project with government-sponsored, malicious forks.

The developers are also refusing travel to France due to these concerns. While the migration won't affect critical security services like signature verification, GrapheneOS believes France is no longer a safe location for their operations. The Le Parisien articles cited by GrapheneOS refer to connections between privacy tools and criminal organizations, suggesting potential legal action against non-cooperative publishers, even if the tools are legitimate. GrapheneOS argues they have been misrepresented and linked to fake versions of their OS used for illicit activities, like the ANOM case where a compromised Android OS was used by the FBI for Operation Trojan Horse.
chinese_title: GrapheneOS 将服务器基础设施从法国迁移。
chinese_summary:
GrapheneOS，一个注重隐私的操作系统，正将其服务器基础设施迁出法国，理由是开源隐私项目的安全担忧。该项目正在将其网站、Mastodon、Discourse和Matrix服务器迁移到多伦多和德国，特别是Netcup。此决定是由法国政府对欧盟聊天控制提案的支持以及《巴黎人报》的负面报道所引发的，GrapheneOS认为该报道将他们的项目与政府赞助的恶意分支混为一谈。

由于这些担忧，开发者们也拒绝前往法国。虽然此次迁移不会影响签名验证等关键安全服务，但GrapheneOS认为法国不再是他们运营的安全地点。《巴黎人报》的文章提到了隐私工具与犯罪组织之间的联系，暗示可能对不合作的发布者采取法律行动，即使这些工具是合法的。GrapheneOS认为他们被错误地描述，并与用于非法活动的操作系统伪造版本联系起来，例如ANOM案例，其中联邦调查局使用受损的Android操作系统进行“特洛伊木马行动”。
